message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: HashMap<Integer, Integer> countMap = new HashMap<>();
List<Integer> masterList = new ArrayList<>();

// Iterate through each ArrayList and count the occurrences of each number
for (List<Integer> list : arrayListMap.values()) {
    Set<Integer> uniqueNumbers = new HashSet<>(list);
    for (Integer number : uniqueNumbers) {
        countMap.put(number, countMap.getOrDefault(number, 0) + 1);
    }
}

// Iterate through the countMap and add numbers that appear in all lists to the masterList
for (Map.Entry<Integer, Integer> entry : countMap.entrySet()) {
    if (entry.getValue() == arrayListMap.size()) {
        masterList.add(entry.getKey());
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: This solution uses a HashMap to count the occurrences of each number in all the lists. It then iterates through the countMap and adds numbers that appear in all lists to the masterList. This solution has a time complexity of O(n*m), where n is the number of lists and m is the average size of the lists.
